extendedIngredients.name: cooked ham
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup (4 oz.) cooked ham, cut into wide, thin strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: cup cooked ham, cut into wide, thin strips

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large garlic cloves, peeled and crushed

extendedIngredients.name: mustard greens
extendedIngredients.original: 8 to 12 oz. broccoli rabe or Chinese mustard greens (gai choy)*, ends trimmed and cut into 2-in. lengths
extendedIngredients.originalName: broccoli rabe or Chinese mustard greens (gai choy)*, ends trimmed and cut into 2-in. lengths

title: Broccoli Rabe and Ham in Ginger Broth
summary: Broccoli Rabe and Ham in Ginger Broth is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 4 servings. One serving contains 181 calories, 11g of protein, and 3g of fat. For $2.51 per serving, this recipe covers 21% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as a side dish. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 30 minutes. Head to the store and pick up chile, ham, garlic cloves, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is solid. Try Ginger-Sesame Broccoli Rabe, Chinese Broccoli Wontons In A Light Ginger-soy Broth, and Jim Lahey's No Knead Pizza with Broccoli Rabe, Garlic, Ginger, and Thai Chilis for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large saucepan over high heat, bring broth, ginger, garlic, and 2 to 4 chile rings to a boil. Cover and simmer until broth is infused with flavor, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove ginger, garlic, and chile with a slotted spoon if you like.                                                                                                 Add ham and greens; add more broth, if needed, to cover greens. Bring to a boil, covered, and cook until greens are barely tender, 2 to 3 minutes.                                                                                                 Divide the soup between 4 serving bowls and top each with a few more red chile rings if you like.                                                                                                *Find Chinese mustard greens in specialty produce markets or farmers' markets.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: In a large saucepan over high heat, bring broth, ginger, garlic, and 2 to 4 chile rings to a boil. Cover and simmer until broth is infused with flavor, 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove ginger, garlic, and chile with a slotted spoon if you like.
Add ham and greens; add more broth, if needed, to cover greens. Bring to a boil, covered, and cook until greens are barely tender, 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide the soup between 4 serving bowls and top each with a few more red chile rings if you like.
*Find Chinese mustard greens in specialty produce markets or farmers' markets.
